bug.author: SouppuoS
bug.summary: seems like something incompatible after torchaudio 0.7.0
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
try to install asteroid on Colab, follow the installation steps in README
ERROR: tensorflow 2.3.0 has requirement tensorboard<3,>=2.3.0, but you'll have tensorboard 2.2.0 which is incompatible. ERROR: torchaudio 0.7.0 has requirement torch==1.7.0, but you'll have torch 1.6.0+cu101 which is incompatible. ERROR: pytorch-lightning 0.9.0 has requirement future>=0.17.1, but you'll have future 0.16.0 which is incompatible. ERROR: pytorch-lightning 0.9.0 has requirement PyYAML>=5.1, but you'll have pyyaml 3.13 which is incompatible.
and run a recipe
Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 11, in from asteroid import DPRNNTasNet File "/content/asteroid/asteroid/init.py", line 3, in from .models import ConvTasNet, DCCRNet, DCUNet, DPRNNTasNet, DPTNet, LSTMTasNet, DeMask File "/content/asteroid/asteroid/models/init.py", line 2, in from .conv_tasnet import ConvTasNet File "/content/asteroid/asteroid/models/conv_tasnet.py", line 1, in from ..filterbanks import make_enc_dec File "/content/asteroid/asteroid/filterbanks/init.py", line 6, in from .griffin_lim import griffin_lim, misi File "/content/asteroid/asteroid/filterbanks/griffin_lim.py", line 7, in from ..dsp.consistency import mixture_consistency File "/content/asteroid/asteroid/dsp/init.py", line 2, in from .overlap_add import LambdaOverlapAdd, DualPathProcessing File "/content/asteroid/asteroid/dsp/overlap_add.py", line 3, in from asteroid.losses.pit_wrapper import PITReorder File "/content/asteroid/asteroid/losses/init.py", line 8, in from .stoi import NegSTOILoss as SingleSrcNegSTOI File "/content/asteroid/asteroid/losses/stoi.py", line 1, in from torch_stoi import NegSTOILoss as _NegSTOILoss File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch_stoi/init.py", line 1, in from .stoi import NegSTOILoss File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch_stoi/stoi.py", line 5, in import torchaudio File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torchaudio/init.py", line 1, in from . import extension File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torchaudio/extension/init.py", line 5, in _init_extension() File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torchaudio/extension/extension.py", line 12, in _init_extension _init_script_module(ext) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torchaudio/extension/extension.py", line 19, in _init_script_module torch.classes.load_library(path) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch/_classes.py", line 46, in load_library torch.ops.load_library(path) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torch/_ops.py", line 105, in load_library ctypes.CDLL(path) File "/usr/lib/python3.6/ctypes/init.py", line 348, in init self._handle = _dlopen(self._name, mode) OSError: /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/torchaudio/_torchaudio.so: undefined symbol: _ZN3c104impl23ExcludeDispatchKeyGuardC1ENS_14DispatchKeySetE
find torchaudio <denchmark-link:https://pypi.org/project/torchaudio/#history>release a new version 0.7.0</denchmark-link> on Oct 28 fixed it by installing torchaudio 0.6.0 manually maybe need version limitation on torchaudio in installation script.

comments.comment: Let's pin torchaudio's version to 0.6.0 for now then. Do you mind submitting a PR?
Just to be sure, how did you install torchaudio in the first place? Because it does work on my end..

I found PyTorch have also relased a new version 1.7.0 on Oct 28... It seems torchaudio 0.7.0 is based on torch 1.7.0, it will crash if you install a lower version like pytorch 1.6.0 (you can try it on colab which is installed 1.6.0 by default) So, maybe both new version or both old version?
Oh ok, I thought it didn't work with 1.7.0.. So we'll revert the PR I guess. Which colab are you talking about by the way?
google colab please revert it XD.
